reviews.sentence: Chattanooga Mini Vacation. I had to visit Chattanooga for business meeting. My wife wanted to come because we had not been there for twenty years. So we decided to make a mini vacation of it. After my short meeting we walked around the downtown area went to the 3D IMAX walked over the Walnut Street pedestrian bridge over the Tennessee river to a beer garden for refreshments then back to a restaurant near our hotel for dinner. After that we enjoyed the pool and spa at the hotel. Our room was great and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The next morning we toured the Chickamauga Battlefield it was very moving and inspiring. On the way home we stopped at Little River Canyon for a hike and to see the vistas on the rim highway. All in all a great getaway.

do not Expect Excellent But Very Good. The staff was very nice and helpful. Some of the best Valet us I have seen. Eager to help with everything and anything I wantedwe have stayed at hundreds of hotels. We had a Guest Services Manager knock on our door and ask our names to make sure we were in the right room. What.

Great hotel in a great location. This was our first stay at the Chatanogan. On previous visits we usually stayed at a competitor just down the street but now we are loyal to the Chatanogan. The hotel is very spacious modern and inviting. From the time you step in the lobby the staff is helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job to keep it that way. What I like best about this hotel is the good price for such a quality hotel in a great location. We were in walking distance to great restaurants and downtown entertainment. We will be coming back for sure.

Good Hotel Great Staff. The staff was helpful and welcoming. The check in and check out process was quick and smooth. The room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The hotel is located in pleasant part of town and entertainment was easily accessible.
Beautiful property excellent staff. No.

Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with granting our specific room request and also with informations on things to do restaurants etc. This hotel had a nice bar with live music that stayed open late.
Beautiful hotel very friendly staff nice and cleanIt was a very positive experience.

The beautiful entrance was pleasant. The customer service upon arrival from Hotel employee was AMAZING. He was willing to bend over backwards at 940 pm to ensure we had a good evening. The restaurant Bistro downstairs had a great breakfast buffet and sThe customer service from everyone except for Hotel employee was horrible. It was like they came from another hotel. Lack of empathy and unorganized. Their lack of communication inconvenienced my family at 940 at night.
Hipster Meets Historic. Just a very well kept older hotel with a kind staff in a lovely little hipster feeling downtown.
Staff was exceptionally accommodating and very friendly Christmas decorations the fire and pool were awesome.
Great service but the hotel is starting to appear dated and worn.

My husband and I recently spent one night at the Chatanogan and we will never be back. At roughly 2 am we were awoken by a conversation that sounded like it was taking place in our room. I woke up thinking there was a video playing on one of our phones. It was not. Only after I woke my husband up did I realize there was light visible between the ceiling and the wall adjoining the room where 2 women were discussing what a scumbag Mike was. I called the front desk and they said they had no other rooms available that they would send security up to quiet the women next door. Security never came I can assure you of this because we could literally hear everything. So 3 hours later I am awakened again by another conversation from next door. I gave up on sleep and turned on a white noise ap on my phone. It was stuffy in the entire hotel the room never got comfortable. I offer two stars still the hotel itself is nice the staff were friendly and it was fairly clean. The paper thin walls that adjoin the rooms are a huge disappointment. I learned entirely too much about our neighbors the front desk did nothing. I ’m not a complainer and I know loud guests are not the fault of the hotel so I did n’t push the issue as we were departing. I feel like I should have looking back.

The rooms bar and fire pit were nice but that is as far as it goes. The room service costs an arm and a leg and the food was terrible. There was not a microwave in the room so you could not reheat the food even if you wanted to. There was a stench in the hallway that made it into our rooms. We stayed here for our family reunion and the food for our banquet which was not cheap was disgusting. I hate to leave a bad review but this place was not worth the money.

Lackluster considering their history. Housekeeping was extremely disappointing. Underwhelming stay. For the cost of the room at this former 4 diamond hotel I expected a different level of service. At check in someone with a similar last name had checked into our room. Not sure how that happened but it took 20 minutes for the front desk staff to solve. The room was average. The bathroom tile had multiple dingy looking chips and cracks surprising for a hotel renovated last year. We went outside the hotel for breakfast and some sightseeing and the neighboring area is fantastic. We arrived back at 145 hoping the room would have been serviced but it has not. I called housekeeping for additional wash clothes but after ringing and ringing no one picked up the phone. I called the front desk and they said they would be sending some up. We waited 15 minutes and I finally walked down to the front desk to see what was the issue. I would n’t have been such a pest but we had to hurry to get ready for a wedding. I explained this to them and specifically asked that housekeeping come after we leave at 330. They said that would n’t be a problem. Another 5 minutes and they finally arrived with more wash clothes. Fast forward post wedding we come back to an unserviced room. I went down to speak with the front desk about my disappointment and I was finally greeted by excellent front desk staff. She rectified the situation and made our below average stay transition into a decent stay. Lobby is nice but wo n’t return.

Fair. Clean. Front desk did n’t communicate with room services in timely manor. I asked for towels and extra blankets. I finally got them 9 hours later at 10 pm. Last told me they were “ just ” notified about it. There are only 4 microwaves in the whole hotel to let people ask for for their rooms. They also ran out of rolaway beds. We had no microwave no rolaway bed and did n’t get extra blankets until 10 pm when we were already sleeping.

Location is very convenient. Easy on off from freeways. Within walking distance of downtown Chattanooga and other attractions such as the Aquarium Art Museum etc. Room was clean building is nice valet staff very courteous. The only trouble we had was when first arriving we realized there was no hair dryer. We called the front desk who told us it ’s on the wall we told them it ’s not they said they ’d send one up but did n’t. She was a bit patronizing. My husband eventually went down to the front desk with a photo of the empty bracket on the wall to prove there was no hair dryer and we received one the next morning.

Nice but not Great. Nice but overpriced. Hotel has good restaurants and grand entrance but rooms are rather mediocre. Fitness center and spa is very nice but the pool leaves a lot to be desired. Room service came in takeout containers which seemed very cheap for the price paid. overall a nice clean hotel but not as grand as the pics.

I worked here 9 years ago as a bellhop valet. The staff WAS friendly timely and considerate. We prided ourselves on how great our customer service was. I pulled up to valet my vehicle. No valet there to open the door for my wife. I asked for help from the valet bellhop and he simply said alright y’ all have a nice night handed me the cart and off he went. The beds USED to be soft and comfortable the building WAS well maintained the rooms USED to be nice. What happened to this place. Awful absolutely awful hotel now. It honestly makes me sad.
Exceptional. Location. Maid service was a little pushy.

4 night stay. Nice staff clean sheets clean bathroom working elevator. WiFi did n’t work in the room they moved me 3 rooms until we found one that had WiFi but was in a lower floor with a smaller room. It was missing a desk lamp which originally had. They sent someone up with a lamp but he told me that the room is n’t supposed to have another lamp even though he was holding it in his hand. He then suggested I move the floor lamp next to the desk. Finally agreed to let me have the lamp though there was n’t much room for it on the smaller desk. All I wanted was a room with working WiFi and a working desk with some light. It took me almost a full evening dealing with that. Besides that it was fine. The fitness center was n’t really a fitness center just a room on the first floor with some weights a bench treadmill and cycling machine. Not even a water cooler. I ’m ok with that it ’s the WiFI issue which annoyed me the most.
